comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Right-click a package containing servlets source code
2. Choose New/Other/Web/Servlet
3. Press "Next"


More information:
My project is a standard java project (not a web project).

The issue is the same when trying from File/New/Other/Web/Servlet.

Nb. I don't know which component I am supposed to choose...

Lilian,

Servlets are supposed to be created in Dynamic Web projects (and not just Java projects).  However, bringing up the Wizard should not cause a NPE.  But you have not provided enough information for us to try to reproduce this... can you please either attach the stack trace of the NullPointerException or else attach a sample Java project that we can use to reproduce the NPE?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Lilian,
> 
> Servlets are supposed to be created in Dynamic Web projects (and not just Java
> projects).  However, bringing up the Wizard should not cause a NPE.  But you
> have not provided enough information for us to try to reproduce this... can you
> please either attach the stack trace of the NullPointerException or else attach
> a sample Java project that we can use to reproduce the NPE?
> 

Carl,

Try starting eclipse in a new workspace, creating a new java project and follow the steps :
1. Right-click a package containing servlets source code
2. Choose New/Other/Web/Servlet
3. Press "Next"

Nothing appends. If I display the Error log view, I can see an "Unhandled event loop exception" :

Lilian,

I did step by step everything you have written but I did not find any exceptions or problems.
It's not reproducible with 2.0.2 and 3.0.

Regards,
Diana

Cannot reproduce it with the latest S-3.0M3-20071111084533 build. 

Lilian, could you also verify that the issue is no more available in the latest WTP 3.0 M3 build? You can download it from this location:
http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/committers/

or from the main WTP download site, when M3 is officially declared on November 14:
http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/
